revised_title: The Role of Thymus in Lymphocyte Development and Circulation
tldr: The authors investigated the relationship between the thymus and circulating lymphocytes in mice. They found that almost all phytohaemagglutinin-induced mitoses of mouse blood lymphocytes had been processed by the thymus before becoming part of the circulating lymphocyte pool. This discovery may have implications for understanding the phytohaemagglutinin reaction in clinical medicine and the role of the thymus in immune responses.
